author: Yanxin Li
title: Owner Hopes to Turn Security App Into the Heart of the Neighborhood - NewsBreak
text:
You’ve just moved into a new neighborhood. You don’t know much about the area, or
any of your neighbors. One day, your worst nightmare becomes a reality. You turn around for
just a second and your child is gone. In your panic you grab your phone, ready to ask your
neighbors for help. You quickly realize you have no one to call. For Huntington resident Michael Hartofilis, the founder of a new neighborhood app
called Howl, this terrifying situation was his reality. “My daughter ran off. She was lost briefly from our property, and I had no means of
connecting with the neighbors on my street when we just moved into our home. I didn't have
anyone’s phone number.” This moment made Hartofilis realize that many emergencies need a quicker response, and
from there his idea for Howl was formed. The new product officially launched in the Huntington
community two weeks ago and has attracted more than 1,000 users. Howl started as a security alert system that allowed users to utilize voice assistants like
Alexa, Google Home, or Siri to create a specific sound and warn emergency contacts in the case
of a medical emergency or home invasion. “We wanted to create a way for people to engage with their immediate community,
whether it’s for emergencies, lost pets, or even just organizing playdates for kids,” Hartofilis
said. Two years ago, the brand took a pivot and headed in a more user-friendly direction. It
took on the look and feel of a social media platform. Hartofilis plans to use Howl to encourage in-
person interactions between neighbors. Howl’s user growth reflects the new software’s success. In 2021, Howl had around 4,500
users. As it evolved, the app reached 8,000 users before the complete transition. With the change
in product positioning, the growth is basically starting over again, he said. “We have in our plan is to grow town by town and you know the street by street so when
a user signs up, they see that neighbors on their street neighbors in their town are also on the
platform and these are the people that they want to engage.” Howl’s growth is currently attributed to word-of-mouth and localized promotion.
With the app still lacking popularity in other places, the Howl team has adopted a
marketing strategy that is as localized as possible. If a user downloads the app and finds out their
neighbors aren’t on the platform, the user experience will greatly diminish. Howl’s most central function is promoting interaction between neighbors. Users can share
information, organize events, and find lost pets on this platform, as well as create a Howl alert
which notifies neighbors on the block and within a one-mile radius. When signing up, to ensure safety, users must provide proof of their address. Howl
ensures that all user interactions are based on real identities to avoid spam.
Howl plans to roll out a new “Events feature” in two to three weeks. “This event feature where you can schedule a public event and see all the verified
neighbors interested in joining they can RSVP,” Hartofilis said. The events feature will allow users to create, post, and participate in local events. Users
can post event details on the platform so that other neighbors can know more about the event and
sign up for events directly. The aim of this feature is to help people connect in the real world.
Howl’s goal is to become a resource for community engagement and local socialization,
that neighborhoods can’t live without. Yanxin Li is a reporter with the SBU Media Group, part of Stony Brook University’s School of
Communication and Journalism’s Working News program for students and local media.

Hard Numbers: US sends billions to Ukraine, Poland’s PM takes aim at beavers, NYC adopts new tool to battle rats, Japan finds longtime death row inmate innocent
new military aidfor the war-torn country. The aid includes new medium-range missiles, air defense, and other security assistance, such as the expansion of training for Ukrainian F-16 pilots. What’s not included in the latest round of aid? The long-range missiles Zelensky has long
wanted.
120,000: You’ve heard of the war on drugs, the war on poverty, the war on terror. But what about the war on beavers? Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk is publicly blaming the country’s 120,000 beavers for exacerbating the deadly floods that battered central Europe and killed at least 16. Tusk called on Poles to “do whatever” to protect dikes, after saying beaver dams can damage riverbanks and weaken levees. “Beaver experts” (yes, they’re a thing) say that only a small percentage are problematic and that their dams can actually help slow river flows.
12: Speaking of a war on rodents, New York City is getting a new tool for its war on rats (a war it’s always losing). The city council passed a bill introducing rat contraceptives in a 12-month pilot problem. The bill’s sponsor, Council Member Shaun Abreu, says, “We can’t poison our way out of the rat problem, but we can certainly do a lot of damage trying.”
acquittedafter decades in solitary confinement for the alleged murders of his boss, the man’s wife, and their children. After 46 years of living on death row, he was freed in 2014 and granted a retrial. That trial has now proven that investigators fabricated the original evidence used against him. Japan and the United States are the only members of the G7 who still use the death penalty.

author: sina.com.cn
title: 中欧科技成长混合A净值上涨3.76%|收益_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
中欧科技成长混合型证券投资基金（简称：中欧科技成长混合A，代码018910）公布4月23日最新净值，上涨3.76%。
中欧科技成长混合A成立于2024年2月2日，业绩比较基准为 中国战略新兴产业成份指数 收益率×70%+中证港股通综合指数(人民币)收益率×10%+银行活期存款利率(税后)×20%。该基金成立以来收益24.85%，今年以来收益5.38%，近一月收益-6.97%，近一年收益37.68%。近一年，该基金排名同类282/7823。
基金经理为代云锋。代云锋自2023年12月20日管理（或拟管理）该基金，任职期内收益24.85%。
最新定期报告显示，该基金前十大重仓股如下：

author: @jagrannews
title: रात में लड़की को भगाकर ले जा रहा था, गांव वालों ने पकड़कर पीटा तो बोला- मदरसे के मौलवी ने सिखाया हिंदू लड़कियां बेचना
text:
रात में लड़की को भगाकर ले जा रहा था, गांव वालों ने पकड़कर पीटा तो बोला- मदरसे के मौलवी ने सिखाया हिंदू लड़कियां बेचना
एक युवक ने नाबालिग को प्रेमजाल में फंसाकर उसके परिवार को नशीली गोलियां खिलाईं और उसे बेचने की कोशिश की। ग्रामीणों ने उसे पकड़कर पुलिस को सौंप दिया। पूछताछ में उसने बताया कि मदरसे के मौलवी हिंदू लड़कियों के साथ गलत काम करने और उन्हें बेचने के लिए कहते हैं। पुलिस ने मामला दर्ज कर आरोपित और मौलवी की तलाश शुरू कर दी है।
जागरण संवाददाता, अमरोहा। मुस्लिम संप्रदाय के एक युवक ने पहले नाबालिग को अपने प्रेमजाल में फंसाया। फिर उससे उसके घर वालों को नशे की गोलियां खिलवाई और बाद में नाबालिग को बेचने के इरादे से रात में लेकर जाने लगे। गांव के लोगों ने उसे देखकर पकड़ लिया और धुनाई कर पुलिस को सौंप दिया। बछरायूं थाने में आरोपित के खिलाफ मामला भी दर्ज हो गया है।
यह है पूरा मामला गजरौला थाने के गांव खादगुजर निवासी आरोपित निजामुद्दीन का गुरुवार की सुबह में एक वीडियो सोशल मीडिया पर वायरल हुआ है। जिसमें उसे गांव लखमिया के ग्रामीणों ने पकड़ रखा है और पूछताछ में वह बता रहा है कि वह खादगुजर गांव का रहने वाला हैं।
बुधवार की रात करीब दो बजे एक नाबालिग को भागकर उसे बेचने जा रहा था। आरोपित से जब ऐसी घटना करना कहां से सीखा? जैसे सवाल किए तो उसने बताया कि मदरसे के मौलवी कहते हैं हिंदू लड़कियों के साथ पहले गलत काम करो, फिर उन्हें बेच दो। इसके बाद ग्रामीणों ने पुलिस को सूचना देकर बुलाया और आरोपित को सौंप दिया। इस दौरान गांव में काफी देर तक हंगामे का माहौल बना रहा।
बछरायूं थाने के प्रभारी निरीक्षक प्रमोद कुमार ने बताया कि मामला संज्ञान में है कि नाबालिग के पिता की तहरीर पर आरोपित के खिलाफ मुकदमा भी दर्ज कर लिया गया है। उसके बयानों के हिसाब से उस मौलवी का भी पता लगाया जाएगा, जो इस तरह की हरकतों को करने के लिए बढ़ावा दे रहा है।
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->human smuggling and trafficking

author: @WITN
title: Dustin’s First Alert Forecast: Another mild day will lead with less wind and partly sunny skies
text: Dustin’s First Alert Forecast: Another mild day will lead with less wind and partly sunny skies Mild air will be traded for an arctic chill GREENVILLE, N.C. (WITN) - As we began Sunday on a cold note, partly sunny skies and less winds, with breezes from the southwest from 10-20 mph. A few gust could peak up to 30 mph in a few isolated spots. Highs will hold in the 50s and lows in the 30s. Another comfortable day for our Martin Luther King Jr. Day for ENC, with partly cloudy skies. Tuesday will start out chilly, then warming up to the upper 40s to low 50s. Chance of rain moves in later in the day, as most areas will see less than a quarter of an inch of rain. If the cold air can catch up with the moisture, a few snow flurries are possible, but will not amount to anything measurable. Any accumulation will be outside of the ENC viewing area and the higher accumulation will be closer towards the NC/VA border. Once the precipitation moves out, we turn cold and sunny. Highs will be in the 30s and 40s, as overnight temperatures fall to the 20s. Another storm system will be moving later Thursday afternoon to ENC. As of the latest data, this looks like another rain event, as snow will be scarce once again. Next weekend will be the coldest air of the winter season in the ENC area since Christmas 2022, as highs stay in the low to mid 30s and lows fall to the teens. Make sure to keep pipes protected, bring in any plants and all pets, and protect yourself when you are out and about. Stay tuned to WITN, [witn.com](http://witn.com/), and the WITN First Alert Weather App for the latest information. Copyright 2024 WITN. All rights reserved.
